Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup with small part of knick at top of handle zone; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed (fired brown) below; black band on top of rim; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of head and upper body of beardless rider to left with back of horse visible at bottom of sherd.
Curator's comments: According to Brijder, the scene represents a horserace. For parallels, see Taranto I. G. 4442, side B (Brijder 1983, pl. 16b no. 52).
Bibliographic references: Brijder 1983a / Siana Cups I and Komast Cups (p. 243, no. 88)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 371, no. B502)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 229, no. 6)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0385) (Phase 1)
